site.title: Vocational Career Development (VCD)
site.subtitle: Professional readiness and digital literacy for high school technical programs.

rules.late_policy: Late submissions accepted only as make-up work during designated Make-Up Days or by instructor approval.
rules.co_op_absence_policy: Co-op absences do not excuse deliverables. Students complete deliverables independently and email the same day or next available opportunity per Make-Up rules.

ai_policy.stance: AI is allowed and expected as a workplace tool, with disclosure and accountability.
rules: AI is a tool, not a replacement for thinking.
Students are responsible for accuracy and must verify claims when needed.
Students must be able to explain their work.
AI may help prepare; students must perform key demonstrations live (e.g., elevator pitch, mock interview).
Undisclosed AI use or misrepresentation of understanding may result in a non-passing status for the deliverable.
ai_policy.disclosure_prompt: If you used AI today, describe exactly how you used it (1–3 sentences) and what you changed after reviewing it.

required_competencies.name: Digital Literacy
required_competencies.description: Professional digital communication, file management habits, digital footprint awareness, safe/ethical tech use.

required_competencies.name: Career Exploration
required_competencies.description: Clear career direction in chosen field, role progression understanding, training/certification plan.

required_competencies.name: Career Readiness
required_competencies.description: Resume + cover letter templates, elevator pitch, mock interview participation, readiness behaviors.

required_competencies.name: Entrepreneurship
required_competencies.description: Business fundamentals and ability to draft a one-page business plan related to the field.

units.title: Digital Literacy, Professionalism & AI Foundations
outcomes: Students communicate professionally via email and digital tools.
Students understand digital footprint and workplace expectations.
Students understand basic AI concepts and ethical, responsible use.

days.title: Digital Professionalism in 2026
days.what: Define digital professionalism and workplace expectations in Automotive and Medical Assisting.
days.why: Employers judge professionalism before technical skill; it impacts hiring and retention.
how: Review examples of professional vs unprofessional digital behavior.
Discuss workplace expectations: responsiveness, tone, documentation.
Create a personal baseline checklist.

resources.title: 10 Things Students Should Never Post on Social Media
resources.description: A guide to avoiding common digital pitfalls.

resources.title: How to Clean Up Your Digital Footprint
resources.description: Practical steps to audit and improve your online presence.

deliverable.title: Professional Email Response (Draft)
deliverable.instructions: Scenario: You are running 15 minutes late for your shift because of unexpected traffic. Write a short professional email to your supervisor (Mr. Jones) explaining the situation and your ETAs. Keep it clear, polite, and complete.

days.title: Professional Email Writing
days.what: Write clear emails with correct subject lines, tone, structure, and next steps.
days.why: Email is still a primary workplace tool and a common cause of miscommunication.
how: Mini-lesson: subject lines, greeting, purpose, ask, close.
Rewrite a poorly written email into a professional one.
Optional AI: generate draft, then revise for accuracy and tone.

resources.title: Email Etiquette for Students
resources.description: Best practices for writing professional emails.

deliverable.title: Rewritten Professional Email
deliverable.instructions: Rewrite the following ‘bad email’ into a professional version: 'hey i cant come in today my car is trippin see ya tomorrow.' Your professional version should include a subject line, proper greeting, clear reason, and a professional closing.

days.title: AI Basics: What It Is / Isn’t
days.what: Understand AI capabilities and limitations (errors, confidence without truth, outdated info).
days.why: Students will use AI at work; misuse creates safety and credibility risks.
how: Define AI in plain language.
Compare: good AI output vs flawed AI output.
Practice: Ask AI 'What are the required oil change intervals for a 2024 Toyota Camry?' then verify this using the official Toyota owner's manual (available on Toyota.com).

resources.title: ChatGPT Ethics: A Guide for Students
resources.description: Understanding the ethical implications of using AI tools.

deliverable.title: AI Use Case in My Field
deliverable.instructions: In 5–7 sentences, explain one realistic way AI could support work in your field AND one risk if used incorrectly.

days.title: AI Ethics & Responsible Use
days.what: Identify ethical vs unethical AI use in school and workplace contexts.
days.why: Ethics, privacy, and safety matter—especially in healthcare and technical trades.
how: Scenario sort: ethical / questionable / unacceptable.
Discuss privacy: patient info, employer data, proprietary procedures.
Create personal AI boundaries for this course.

deliverable.title: AI Ethics Reflection
deliverable.instructions: Review these scenarios: (A) Using AI to research how a specific engine component works. (B) Using AI to write a patient summary without checking the facts. (C) Using AI to generate a template for a cover letter and then adding your own details. Reflect on which are ethical and why. Then answer: (1) When is AI use appropriate? (2) When is it not? (3) What will you do to stay accountable?

days.title: Digital Footprint & Professional Identity
days.what: Understand digital footprint and how employers evaluate candidates online.
days.why: Digital footprint can block opportunities even when skills are strong.
how: Self-audit using checklist.
Discuss privacy settings and professional presence.
Plan one concrete improvement action.

resources.title: How to Google Yourself (And Why You Should)
resources.description: A guide from NYU on auditing your personal brand.

deliverable.title: Digital Professionalism Checklist
deliverable.instructions: Audit yourself against these 5 items: (1) Google Search: Is your public presence professional? (2) Profile Photos: Is your current avatar workplace-appropriate? (3) Privacy Settings: Are personal posts hidden from the public? (4) Email Handle: Is it a professional version of your name? (5) Bio/About: Does it reflect your career goals? Submit a 'Pass/Fail' for each and describe one specific action to improve (e.g., 'Update my LinkedIn photo' or 'Change my Instagram to private').

days.title: Unit 1 Workday: Fix & Complete
days.what: Complete any missing Unit 1 artifacts and revise quality issues.
days.why: Pass/Fail requires completion and professional quality.
how: Students review a Unit 1 artifact tracker.
Independent work + instructor check-ins.
Resubmit improved artifacts if needed.

deliverable.title: Unit 1 Status Email
deliverable.instructions: Email: list which Unit 1 deliverables are complete and which are still missing (if any).

days.title: Workplace Tools & File Habits
days.what: Basic workplace file organization and documentation habits.
days.why: Lost files and poor documentation cost time, money, and credibility.
how: Create a standard folder structure.
Name files professionally.
Document a simple process in steps.

deliverable.title: Process Steps Document
deliverable.instructions: Exemplar Structure: (1) Goal. (2) Safety/Prep. (3) Sequence (Steps 1-8). (4) Verification/Clean-up. Write 6–10 detailed steps for a core task. Example: 'How to perform a multi-point inspection' or 'How to prepare a room for patient intake'. Avoid vague steps like 'do it'; use actionable verbs like 'inspect', 'sanitize', or 'tighten'.

days.title: Digital Communication: Text vs Email vs In-Person
days.what: Choose the right channel for the right message.
days.why: Wrong channel creates conflict and misunderstandings at work.
how: Given scenarios, decide best communication method.
Write one message in the correct channel style.

deliverable.title: Scenario Response (Channel Choice)
deliverable.instructions: Pick one scenario and write the correct response (email or message) + one sentence explaining why that channel fits.

days.title: Unit 1 Verification Check
days.what: Finalize Unit 1 artifacts and verify pass status.
days.why: Clear checkpoints prevent end-of-year failures.
how: Checklist review.
Students correct missing items.
Instructor verifies completion.

deliverable.title: Unit 1 Completion Confirmation
deliverable.instructions: Email: confirm completion of all Unit 1 deliverables and attach/link anything missing previously.

days.title: Transition Day: Career Exploration Launch
days.what: Introduce career exploration and build momentum.
days.why: Direction drives effort and persistence.
how: Define ‘career ladder’ and typical role progression in each field.
Start role research with verification expectations.

deliverable.title: 3 Roles in My Field
deliverable.instructions: List 3 roles (entry, mid, advanced) in your field with 1 sentence each describing what they do.

units.title: Career Exploration & AI-Informed Planning
outcomes: Students identify realistic roles and pathways in their field.
Students can use AI for research while verifying information.

days.title: Career Ladder Deep Dive
days.what: Explore role progression and what increases pay/responsibility.
days.why: Students need a real plan beyond ‘get a job’.
how: Role research by program.
Identify required skills and common employers.
Verify at least one detail using a second source.

deliverable.title: Career Ladder Notes
deliverable.instructions: Research this sample ladder for your field: (1) Lube Technician -> Lead Tech -> Shop Manager OR (2) Medical Assistant -> Senior MA -> Clinic Coordinator. Submit 3-5 sentences on what skills or certs are needed for the 'Lead' or 'Senior' role.

days.title: Training Paths & Credentials
days.what: Identify training routes (certs, licenses, degrees, apprenticeships).
days.why: Wrong path wastes time and money.
how: Research typical requirements for your target role.
Discuss verification: AI can be wrong—confirm with credible sources.

deliverable.title: Credential Plan (Draft)
deliverable.instructions: List 3 specific credentials. Example (Auto): ASE G1 Inspection, Ford/Toyota Factory Certs. Example (Medical): National Certified Medical Assistant (NCMA), CPR/BLS, Phlebotomy Tech. For each, list (1) the Cert Name, (2) Who provides it, and (3) one requirement to earn it (e.g., '2 years experience' or 'pass a 50-question exam').

days.title: Career Pathway Map
days.what: Map your career path from now to your target role.
days.why: A visible plan increases follow-through.
how: Create a pathway map (bulleted, table, or diagram).
Include timeline checkpoints.

deliverable.title: Career Pathway Map (Draft)
deliverable.instructions: Create a 4-step map. Exemplar: Step 1: Complete CTE Program (Next 6 months). Step 2: Earn NCMA or ASE cert (End of year 1). Step 3: Entry Role as Tech/MA at [Specific Local Employer] (Year 2). Step 4: Lead Tech/Admin Role (Year 5). Include approximate months/years for each step.

days.title: Career Goal Statement
days.what: Write a clear, realistic goal statement.
days.why: Employers and mentors respond to clarity.
how: Draft 1 page max: goal, why, plan, next steps.
AI allowed for drafting; student must revise.

deliverable.title: Career Goal Statement (Draft)
deliverable.instructions: Use this template: 'My long-term goal is to become a [Role]. To get there, I will first earn my [Cert/License] within [Timeframe]. I will start by [Action 1] and [Action 2].' Submit 1 page max.

days.title: Verification & Revision
days.what: Improve accuracy and realism of career research.
days.why: Planning only works if it’s true.
how: Peer review + instructor feedback.
Revise based on verification.

deliverable.title: Career Artifacts (Revised Set)
deliverable.instructions: Submit revised: pathway map + credential plan + goal statement.

days.title: Co-op Flex Day: Catch-Up 1
days.what: Make-up and catch-up day for Unit 2 artifacts.
days.why: Co-op schedule requires flexible completion routes.
how: Independent work time + check-ins.

deliverable.title: Unit 2 Status Email
deliverable.instructions: Email what’s completed and what is missing for Unit 2.

days.title: Co-op Flex Day: Catch-Up 2
days.what: Finish any missing Unit 2 components.
days.why: Prevent backlog before Career Readiness unit.
how: Independent completion + resubmission.

deliverable.title: Missing Items Submission
deliverable.instructions: Email any missing Unit 2 deliverables or corrected versions.

days.title: Reality Check: Barriers & Solutions
days.what: Identify obstacles and build strategies to stay on track.
days.why: Plans fail without coping strategies.
how: List top 3 barriers.
Create 1 strategy per barrier.

deliverable.title: Barriers & Strategies
deliverable.instructions: Identify 3 realistic obstacles (e.g., 'Transportation to my first job', 'Cost of certification exams', 'Lack of work experience'). For each, provide a 'If/Then' strategy. Exemplar: 'If I can't afford the ASE exam, then I will research employer-sponsored testing or apply for a school grant.'

days.title: Professional Networking Basics
days.what: How to ask for help, mentorship, and opportunities.
days.why: Opportunities often come through people, not applications.
how: Draft a professional outreach message.
Practice tone and clarity.

deliverable.title: Professional Outreach Draft
deliverable.instructions: Write an outreach message using this structure: 'Hi [Name], I'm a student in the VCD program at [School]. I'm interested in [Field] and was wondering if you could share one piece of advice for someone starting out. Thank you, [Your Name].'

days.title: Unit 2 Verification Checkpoint
days.what: Confirm Unit 2 completion.
days.why: Checkpoint ensures readiness for resumes/interviews.
how: Review tracker and submit any missing items.

deliverable.title: Unit 2 Completion Confirmation
deliverable.instructions: Email confirming Unit 2 deliverables are complete; attach/link any missing items.

days.title: Transition: Career Readiness Launch
days.what: Introduce resumes/cover letters/interviews.
days.why: Students need job-ready materials now.
how: Review what employers look for and common mistakes.

deliverable.title: Resume Info Collection
deliverable.instructions: Collect details for these categories: (1) Technical Skills: Brake lathes, scan tools, patient vitals, medical software. (2) Soft Skills: Punctuality, documentation, team communication. (3) Experience: Work history, volunteer work, or CTE lab projects. (4) Certs: OSHA 10, CPR, ASE. Submit these in a list to use for your resume tomorrow.

days.title: Resume Structure
days.what: Build resume structure from student information.
days.why: A resume is a marketing document, not a biography.
how: Create sections: summary, skills, experience, education, certs.
AI allowed to rephrase bullets; student verifies truth.

deliverable.title: Resume Outline
deliverable.instructions: Submit a resume outline with headings and bullet placeholders.

days.title: Resume Draft 1
days.what: Create first full resume draft.
days.why: Drafting early leaves time for revisions.
how: Write draft; peer review for clarity and accuracy.

deliverable.title: Resume Draft 1
deliverable.instructions: Submit resume draft as doc/PDF or share link.

days.title: Resume Revision
days.what: Improve resume impact using action verbs and measurable outcomes.
days.why: Strong bullets improve interview chances.
how: Revise with feedback; optional AI to strengthen phrasing.

deliverable.title: Resume Draft 2
deliverable.instructions: Submit revised resume draft with at least 3 improved bullets.

days.title: Resume Finalization Checkpoint
days.what: Lock a clean resume version.
days.why: Foundation for cover letters and interview prep.
how: Final proofread and formatting check.

deliverable.title: Resume Final (Checkpoint)
deliverable.instructions: Submit your clean resume version (can be revised later, but this is your baseline).

units.title: Career Readiness: Resume, Cover Letter, Pitch & Interviews
outcomes: Students have a final resume and reusable cover letter template.
Students deliver a clear elevator pitch.
Students participate in at least one mock interview.

days.title: Cover Letter Purpose & Structure
days.what: Understand cover letter structure and tone.
days.why: A cover letter can differentiate candidates when experience is similar.
how: Review template; identify what changes vs stays constant.

deliverable.title: Cover Letter Template (Draft)
deliverable.instructions: Submit a reusable cover letter template with placeholders for job/company.

days.title: Cover Letter Customization
days.what: Customize a cover letter to a specific job posting.
days.why: Employers want relevance, not generic letters.
how: Use a sample job posting; customize letter.

deliverable.title: Customized Cover Letter
deliverable.instructions: Scenario: Apply for an 'Entry-Level Technician' or 'Medical Assistant I' role at 'City Systems'. The posting emphasizes 'punctuality, basic digital literacy, and a willingness to learn'. Customize your cover letter template for this specific role.

days.title: Elevator Pitch Draft
days.what: Write a 20–30 second elevator pitch.
days.why: Introductions happen constantly in interviews and workplaces.
how: Draft pitch; focus on clarity, confidence, and relevance.

deliverable.title: Elevator Pitch (Written)
deliverable.instructions: Use this template: 'Hi, I'm [Name] and I'm a student in the VCD [Program] track. I've developed skills in [Skill 1] and [Skill 2], and I'm currently working toward my [Cert] certification. I'm passionate about [Industry Goal] and am looking for an opportunity to contribute to a team as a [Target Role].' Submit your 20–30 second script.

days.title: Elevator Pitch Practice
days.what: Practice delivering the pitch naturally.
days.why: Delivery matters as much as content.
how: Practice in pairs; feedback on volume, pacing, confidence.

deliverable.title: Pitch Reflection
deliverable.instructions: Write 3 bullets: what went well, what to improve, what you will practice.

days.title: Interview Basics
days.what: Common interview questions and what they are really asking.
days.why: Interviews are a skill; preparation reduces anxiety.
how: Discuss common questions; draft answer outlines.

deliverable.title: Interview Answers Outline
deliverable.instructions: Context: Employers ask these to see if you are prepared and reliable. (1) 'Tell me about yourself': Focus on your training and one specific technical project. (2) 'Top 3 strengths': Choose skills like 'Attention to detail in brake systems' or 'Accuracy in patient vitals'. (3) 'Why this industry': Express your long-term commitment. Outline clear, 3-sentence responses for each.

days.title: AI for Interview Prep (Ethical Use)
days.what: Use AI to practice interviews without faking experience.
days.why: AI can help rehearse, but authenticity must remain.
how: Generate practice questions.
Refine answers while staying truthful.
Identify red-flag AI behaviors (over-polished, false claims).

deliverable.title: Interview Practice Log
deliverable.instructions: Submit: 3 questions you practiced + improved answer notes (truthful).

days.title: Mock Interview Round 1
days.what: Complete a mock interview.
days.why: Practice builds confidence and real readiness.
how: Interview rotations; feedback checklist.

deliverable.title: Mock Interview Participation
deliverable.instructions: Roleplay Scenario: You are interviewing for a junior role. Have a peer or AI act as the interviewer (Mr. Green). They ask: 'Why should we hire you over someone with more experience?' Email a short summary of how you answered + one thing you'd change next time.

days.title: Mock Interview Round 2 / Makeups
days.what: Second round or makeup interview.
days.why: Ensure all students complete requirement.
how: Rotations and targeted practice.

deliverable.title: Mock Interview Evidence
deliverable.instructions: Email reflection as evidence of completion (or schedule makeup).

days.title: Resume + Cover Letter Finalization
days.what: Polish documents to final quality.
days.why: These become reusable career assets.
how: Formatting, proofreading, clarity checks.

deliverable.title: Final Resume + Cover Letter Template
deliverable.instructions: Submit final resume and reusable cover letter template.

days.title: Professional Portfolio Basics
days.what: Organize career documents and evidence.
days.why: A simple portfolio supports applications and interviews.
how: Create a folder or drive structure; organize artifacts.

deliverable.title: Portfolio Link/Structure
deliverable.instructions: Exemplar Naming: '01_Resume_LastName.pdf', '02_CoverLetter_LastName.pdf', '03_PathwayMap_LastName.pdf'. Organize your work into a folder named 'VCD_CareerPortfolio_LastName'. Submit the link or a screenshot showing this structure.

days.title: Co-op Flex Day: Catch-Up
days.what: Make-up and completion day for Unit 3 requirements.
days.why: Prevent backlog for end-of-unit pass verification.
how: Independent work and resubmissions.

deliverable.title: Unit 3 Status Email
deliverable.instructions: Email which Unit 3 deliverables are complete and which are missing.

days.title: Workplace Behavior & Reliability
days.what: Attendance, punctuality, communication, and reliability habits.
days.why: Reliability is a top hiring/retention factor.
how: Discuss expectations; build a personal reliability plan.

deliverable.title: Reliability Plan
deliverable.instructions: Write 3 reliability commitments + what you will do when problems come up.

days.title: Workplace Conflict & Communication
days.what: Handle feedback and conflict professionally.
days.why: Soft skills prevent job loss.
how: Scenario responses; professional phrasing practice.

deliverable.title: Scenario Response (Conflict)
deliverable.instructions: Scenario: A teammate tells you that your documentation style is 'sloppy' and needs to be redone. Respond professionally: (1) Acknowledge the feedback. (2) Ask for a specific example of what to improve. (3) Propose a solution/next step.

days.title: Unit 3 Verification Checkpoint
days.what: Verify completion of all readiness artifacts.
days.why: Pass/Fail requires completion and acceptable quality.
how: Tracker review and final submissions.

deliverable.title: Unit 3 Completion Confirmation
deliverable.instructions: Email confirmation that Unit 3 requirements are complete; attach/link missing items if needed.

days.title: Transition: Entrepreneurship Launch
days.what: Define entrepreneurship in Automotive/Medical contexts.
days.why: Many skilled workers become owners or managers.
how: Examples of businesses; discuss value proposition.

deliverable.title: Business Idea (Field-Specific)
deliverable.instructions: Think of a problem in your field (e.g., long wait times for oil changes or difficulty tracking patient vitals). Describe your business idea: 'My business, [Name], solves the problem of [Problem] by [Solution].'

days.title: How Businesses Work
days.what: Customers, costs, revenue, operations.
days.why: Understanding basics improves employability and leadership readiness.
how: Mini-lesson + examples; map simple business flow.

deliverable.title: Business Operations Paragraph
deliverable.instructions: Explain how a business in your field functions day-to-day (1 paragraph).

days.title: Pricing, Costs, and Profit (Basics)
days.what: How pricing relates to cost and profit.
days.why: Owners and employees must understand how money works in business.
how: Simple example calculation; discuss tradeoffs.

deliverable.title: Cost vs Price Example
deliverable.instructions: Imagine you provide a service (e.g., an oil change or a blood pressure check). (1) List one direct 'Cost' (supplies/time). (2) Set a 'Price' for the service. (3) Explain why the difference (profit) is necessary for the business to survive.

days.title: AI in Business (Ethical + Practical)
days.what: How AI supports businesses and where boundaries exist.
days.why: AI can improve productivity but introduces privacy/safety risks.
how: Examples in each field; discuss do’s and don’ts.

deliverable.title: Responsible AI Use in My Business
deliverable.instructions: Describe 2 ways AI could help and 1 ethical boundary you must follow.

days.title: One-Page Business Plan Draft
days.what: Draft a simple, one-page business plan.
days.why: Planning clarifies viability and execution steps.
how: Use template: problem, customer, solution, operations, costs, marketing, AI support.

deliverable.title: Business Plan Draft
deliverable.instructions: Exemplar: Problem: 'Many local car owners can't get an oil change on weekends.' Solution: 'Weekend-only mobile lube service.' Customer: 'Busy professionals/families.' Marketing: 'Facebook groups and flyer drops.' Use the template at the bottom of the page (Problem, customer, solution...) and fill in 2-3 sentences per section.

days.title: Business Plan Revision
days.what: Revise plan for clarity and realism.
days.why: Real plans require iteration.
how: Peer feedback + instructor notes; revise accordingly.

deliverable.title: Business Plan Revised
deliverable.instructions: Submit revised plan with at least 3 improvements.

units.title: Entrepreneurship Completion & Final Verification
outcomes: Students complete a one-page business plan aligned to their field.
Students understand business fundamentals and responsible AI integration.
Students complete final verification for Pass/Fail.

days.title: Marketing Basics
days.what: How businesses attract and retain customers.
days.why: Even great services fail without customers.
how: Define customer, channel, message; create a simple marketing idea.

deliverable.title: Marketing Message
deliverable.instructions: Exemplar: 'Tired of waiting in diagnostic lines? [Business Name] provides mobile brake diagnostics that come to you. Professional service, transparent pricing, and weekend availability. Contact us today for a quotes.' Write a similar 3-6 sentence message for your specific business idea.

days.title: Customer Experience & Reputation
days.what: Reviews, professionalism, reliability, service quality.
days.why: Reputation drives repeat business and referrals.
how: Discuss examples; create a customer experience standard.

deliverable.title: Customer Experience Standard
deliverable.instructions: List 5 standards. Exemplar: (1) 'We will respond to all quotes within 2 hours.' (2) 'We will maintain a clean and organized workspace.' (3) 'We will explain all technical issues in plain English to customers.' (4) 'We will follow up 48 hours after service.' (5) 'We will offer a satisfaction guarantee on all labor.'

days.title: Business Plan Finalization
days.what: Finalize the one-page business plan.
days.why: Final artifact required for passing Entrepreneurship.
how: Proofread, finalize sections, ensure realism and ethics.

deliverable.title: Business Plan Final
deliverable.instructions: Submit final one-page business plan (clean formatting).

days.title: OSHA 10 Verification
days.what: Confirm OSHA 10 completion status.
days.why: Safety credential is required for program compliance.
how: Students submit proof or identify missing steps.

deliverable.title: OSHA 10 Proof
deliverable.instructions: Email proof of OSHA 10 completion (certificate/screenshot) or request the makeup plan.

days.title: Final Portfolio Assembly
days.what: Compile all required artifacts into a single organized portfolio.
days.why: Organized artifacts simplify verification and future use.
how: Create a single folder; label files consistently.

deliverable.title: Portfolio Link
deliverable.instructions: Email a link to your organized portfolio folder (or attach zipped folder if needed).

days.title: AI Reflection: My Responsible Use Plan
days.what: Reflect on responsible AI use in school and work.
days.why: AI competence is a career skill; ethics prevents harm.
how: Write a short reflection with specific examples.

deliverable.title: Responsible AI Use Plan
deliverable.instructions: Write 8–12 sentences: how you will use AI to support your career and what boundaries you will follow.

days.title: Make-Up Day 1
days.what: Catch up on missing artifacts.
days.why: Pass/Fail requires completeness.
how: Independent work + resubmission.

deliverable.title: Make-Up Submission
deliverable.instructions: Email any missing deliverables as a bundle; list what each file/link is.

days.title: Make-Up Day 2
days.what: Second catch-up window and verification support.
days.why: Ensure students on co-op can complete requirements.
how: Complete and resubmit missing work.

deliverable.title: Updated Status Email
deliverable.instructions: Email updated status: complete/incomplete list of required artifacts.

days.title: Verification Conference Prep
days.what: Prepare for final verification (what’s done, what’s missing).
days.why: Clear accountability prevents surprises.
how: Students self-check using the required artifacts list.

deliverable.title: Self-Verification Checklist
deliverable.instructions: Submit a checklist confirming each required artifact is complete with link/file name.

days.title: Final Verification Day 1
days.what: Instructor verifies portfolios and completion evidence.
days.why: Formal pass/fail determination requires verification.
how: Student conferences / verification review.

deliverable.title: Verification Follow-Up
deliverable.instructions: Email any missing items requested during verification review.

days.title: Final Verification Day 2
days.what: Complete remaining verifications and finalize statuses.
days.why: Final clarity for students and administration.
how: Final checks and last resubmissions.

deliverable.title: Final Submission Bundle
deliverable.instructions: Email final bundle of any outstanding artifacts (if applicable).

days.title: Course Reflection
days.what: Reflect on skills gained and next steps.
days.why: Reflection consolidates learning and improves transfer to real life.
how: Short reflection prompt.

deliverable.title: Course Reflection
deliverable.instructions: Write 10–12 sentences: what you learned, what you improved, and your next step in your career plan.

days.title: Professional Next-Step Plan
days.what: Define immediate next actions (30-day plan).
days.why: Plans without actions don’t change outcomes.
how: Set 3 actions + dates.

deliverable.title: 30-Day Action Plan
deliverable.instructions: List 3 concrete actions you will take in the next 30 days with target dates.

days.title: Final Pass/Fail Communication
days.what: Students confirm final status and any remaining gaps.
days.why: Final communication prevents disputes and confusion.
how: Students send a final status confirmation.

deliverable.title: Final Status Confirmation Email
deliverable.instructions: Email: confirm you have submitted all required artifacts and provide your portfolio link.

days.title: Closeout Day
days.what: Celebrate completion and reinforce workplace expectations.
days.why: Closure increases retention and confidence.
how: Brief wrap + optional share-outs.

deliverable.title: Final Thank-You / Professional Message
deliverable.instructions: Write a professional thank-you message to a mentor/instructor/employer (template style).

sections: Costs (What do you need to pay for?)
Responsible AI Use (How AI helps + your boundaries)
